executed_commands.description: Comprehensive pod status and health validation
executed_commands.command: kubectl get pods -n default | grep kube-znn | head -10
executed_commands.expected_output: All pods running and ready with proper resource allocation
executed_commands.success_criteria: All pods show Running status with Ready condition
executed_commands.failure_indicators: Any pod shows Pending, Error, CrashLoopBackOff, or resource issues

executed_commands.description: Service discovery and endpoint connectivity validation
executed_commands.command: kubectl get svc -n default | grep kube-znn
executed_commands.expected_output: Valid cluster IP and active endpoints
executed_commands.success_criteria: Service has valid cluster IP with active endpoint subsets
executed_commands.failure_indicators: Service has no cluster IP, pending status, or empty endpoints

executed_commands.description: Resource utilization and performance metrics analysis
executed_commands.command: kubectl top pods -n default | grep kube-znn
executed_commands.expected_output: CPU and memory usage metrics for all containers
executed_commands.success_criteria: Pods show optimal resource utilization within defined limits
executed_commands.failure_indicators: Pods show excessive CPU/memory usage or resource contention

executed_commands.description: Comprehensive log analysis for system health
executed_commands.command: kubectl logs -n default -l app=kube-znn-simple-fixed-simple-fixed --tail=100 --timestamps || kubectl logs -n default $(kubectl get pods -n default | grep kube-znn | head -1 | awk '{print $1}') --tail=100 --timestamps
executed_commands.expected_output: Clean logs with proper timestamps and no critical errors
executed_commands.success_criteria: No ERROR, FATAL, or critical warnings in recent logs
executed_commands.failure_indicators: Critical errors, warnings, or abnormal log patterns detected

executed_commands.description: Service endpoint accessibility and response validation
executed_commands.command: kubectl exec -n default $(kubectl get pods -n default | grep kube-znn | head -1 | awk '{print $1}') -- curl -s -o /dev/null -w '%{http_code} %{time_total}' http://localhost:80/news.php
executed_commands.success_criteria: HTTP 200 response with response time within acceptable thresholds
executed_commands.failure_indicators: Non-200 HTTP response, connection failure, or excessive response time

execution_results.command: kubectl get pods -n default | grep kube-znn | head -10
execution_results.description: Comprehensive pod status and health validation
execution_results.detailed_description: Retrieves current status of ZNN pods including their state (Running, Pending, Error) and readiness indicators. This command verifies that all ZNN pods are healthy and accessible.
